content.question: A negatively charged rod is brought close to, but does not touch, an isolated, neutral conducting sphere. The sphere is then grounded. The ground is then removed, and the rod pulled away from the sphere. Which of the following correctly states the new charge on the sphere and provides an accurate statement of reasoning to support this claim?

choices.label: The sphere becomes positively charged, because negative charges move from the sphere to the ground.
The sphere becomes positively charged, because positive charges move from ground to the sphere.
The sphere becomes negatively charged, because positive charges move from the sphere to the ground.
The sphere becomes negatively charged, because negative charges move from ground to the sphere.
The sphere remains neutral, because it was grounded during the charging process.

content.answer: The sphere becomes positively charged, because negative charges move from the sphere to the ground.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
